metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data of Early Cretaceous Xiabie Co granite porphyries in northern Nyima area, central Tibet
metadata.description: This is geochemical data of late Early Cretaceous granite porphyries collected from Xiabe Co area in northern Nyima, central Tibet. It includes the  whole rock major element contents were obtained by X-ray fluorescence spectrometer, and the whole rock trace elements were obtained by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, whole rock Nd isotopic data were obtained by multi collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, and zircon Hf isotopic data were analyzed by laser ablation combined with multi collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, the zircon U-Pb isotopic data were measured by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) and secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS), the zircon trace elements were obtained by LA-ICPMS, the mineral major oxide compositions were obtained by electron microprobe analysis.
metadata.instructions: The obtained data are all tabulated in Excel sheet. The file with name of MineralMajorContents is the major oxides contents of rock forming minerals; the file named with WholeRockMajorTrace.xls displays whole rock major and Trace element contents; whole rock Nd isotope data are listed in file named with WholeRockNdIsotope.xls; the file of ZirconHf.xls shows zircon Lu-Hf isotopic data; the file of ZirconUPbTraceComposition.xls contains zircon U-Pb isotopic data and trace elements concentrations.

literatureList.titleEn: Rare earth element tetrad effect and negative Ce anomalies of the granite porphyries in sothern Qiangtang Terrane, central Tibet: New insights into the genesis of highly evolved granites

Lithos, 312-313, 258-273.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to analyze the geochemical properties of granitic porphyry from the Early Cretaceous in northern Nima County, Tibet?
Example.Answer: An example of a data collection method in this field involves using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry to analyze major elements in whole rock samples, and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry to determine trace element contents. Additionally, multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry is employed for obtaining Nd isotope data from rocks, while zircon Hf isotope data is gathered using laser ablation combined with multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Zircon U-Pb isotope data and zircon trace element data are collected through laser ablation combined with inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry and secondary ion mass spectrometry. Major element data of rock minerals are analyzed using an electron probe.

Quantification.Question: How many types of isotopic data are collected in a dataset related to early Cretaceous granitic porphyry geochemistry from northern Nyima County, Tibet?

Definition.Question: What is the role of X-ray fluorescence spectrometry in geochemical data collection for granitic porphyry analysis?
Definition.Answer: X-ray fluorescence spectrometry is used to analyze the major elemental composition of whole-rock samples in geochemical data collection for granitic porphyry analysis.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental and procedural steps involved in collecting and analyzing geochemical data from granitic porphyry in a northern Tibetan region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection involves using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry to analyze the whole-rock major elements, and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) for trace element content. Additionally, multi-collector ICP-MS is used to measure Nd isotopic data of the rocks, while zircon Hf isotopic data is obtained through laser ablation coupled with multi-collector ICP-MS. Zircon U-Pb isotopic data and zircon trace element data are collected using laser ablation with ICP-MS and secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS). Lastly, electron probe microanalysis is used to determine the major element data of rock minerals.
